 Accessibility services 
 Concordia supports students with a variety of disability conditions through the  Access Centre for Students with Disabilities  (ACSD). Please contact and  register with ACSD  to take advantage of Concordia's accessibility services. 
 Who can use the ACSD? 
 Students with a variety of disability conditions can use the ACSD. Some examples are: vision, mobility, hearing, chronic medical conditions, learning disabilities, attention deficit disorder, mental health conditions, Autism Spectrum Disorder and other Neurodevelopmental Disorders. 
 The centre can also provide services and accommodations to students with temporary disability conditions that are generally the result of illness or injury. 
 Register with us 
 Our mission and statistics 
 Accommodations and services offered 
 Advising 
 Get personal advising from our accessiblity advisors. 
 New students 
 New students! Discover ACSD services. 
 Workshops 
 Workshops on a variety of disability-related topics. 
 Note-taking service 
 A service providing legible and organised class notes.   
 Exam service 
 Instructions and help on all tests, from quizzes to final exams. 
 Learning strategies support 
 We put you in touch with learning support specialists.  
 Government funding 
 Funding opportunities for specialised services or supports. 
 e-text conversion service 
 Go from hard copy to digital with our textbook and coursepack conversion service.  
 Transportation accessibility 
 Designated accessible parking spots and wheelchair-accessible shuttle buses. 
 ASL/LSQ interpretation 
 Sign Language Interpretation or note-taking for hearing-impaired or deaf students. 
 Adaptive or assistive technology 
 The ACSD has a technology consultant who is available by appointment. Come and get the most out of your technology or discuss other products to suit your academic needs. 
  
 Adaptive software 
 Reading and writing tools 
 University policies 
 There are numerous University policies which detail both the rights and responsibilities of each member of the university community. Links to two of the most pertinent policies for students registered with the ACSD can be found here: 
 Policy on Accessibility for Students with Disabilities (PRVPAA-14) 
 Policy concerning the protection of personal information (SG-9)
